intro: Trichotosia ediensis, commonly known as the Ediense Trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in late spring. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Trichotosia ediensis is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure.
